{{short description|Electricity, water, and sanitation company}}
{{peacock|date=February 2019}}
{{UPE|date=September 2022}}
{{Infobox company
 | name                = Eranove
 | type                = Public limited company
 | founded             = 2005
 | hq_location_city    = Paris
 | hq_location_country = France
 | industry            = Amenities provider
 | owners              = [[Emerging Capital Partners]] (53.3 %)
 | key_people          = Vincent Le Guennou, Marc Albérola
 | num_employees       = {{formatnum:9000}}
 | revenue             = €430 million
 | website             = {{url|http://www.eranove.com}}
}}

'''Eranove''' is a French company active in the management of [[public service]]s and in the production of electricity and drinking water in Africa. The company was formerly known as Finagestion.

The Eranove Group has been present in [[Ivory Coast|Côte d'Ivoire]] ({{ILL|SODECI|fr|Société de distribution d'eau de la Côte d'Ivoire}}, {{ILL|Compagnie ivoirienne d'électricité|fr}}, {{ILL|Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'Electricite|fr}}, AWALE and SMART ENERGY) for several decades, in [[Senegal]] (SDE) since 1996, and in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Democratic Republic of Congo]] since 2012 (service contract with [[Regideso]]). The group has also been developing projects in Mali since 2015 (Kénié Énergie Renouvelable), Gabon (Louetsi Hydro, Asokh Energy, Orélo),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://africtelegraph.com/gabon-lancement-des-societes-asokh-energy-et-louetsi-hydro/|title = Gabon : Lancement des sociétés ASOKH ENERGY et LOUETSI HYDRO|date = 14 May 2018}}</ref> Madagascar ([[Sahofika Hydroelectric Power Station|Sahofika]]), and Togo (Kékéli Efficient Power). It generated revenues of €576 million in 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.agenceecofin.com/production/3110-61382-eranove-en-route-pour-une-production-d-energie-plus-propre-au-togo|title=Eranove : " En route pour une production d'énergie plus propre au Togo "|date=31 October 2018|website=Agence Ecofin|access-date=19 December 2018}}</ref>

Eranove operates an installed capacity of more than 1,250 MW. The group employs more than 9,000 people and serves 1.9 million customers for electricity, 1.8 million for water<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.gaboninitiatives.com/fgis-groupe-eranove-lancent-societes-projet-centrales-hydroelectriques/|title=Le FGIS et le Groupe Eranove lancent les sociétés de projet pour les deux centrales hydroélectriques - Gabon Initiatives, Actualité Libreville|website=www.gaboninitiatives.com|date=15 May 2018|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> and 470,000 for sanitation. The majority shareholder of the Eranove Group is ECP Finagestion FII S.a.r.l., affiliated with [[Emerging Capital Partners]], a private equity firm.

== History ==
Between 2005 and 2006, the [[Bouygues|Bouygues Group]] sold its public services subsidiary, [[Saur (company)|Saur]], while retaining its African and Italian assets.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lesechos.fr/16/11/2004/LesEchos/19286-108-ECH_bouygues-boucle-la-vente-pour-1-037-milliard-d-euros-de-la-saur.htm|title=Bouygues boucle la vente pour 1,037 milliard d'euros de la SAUR|website=lesechos.fr|date=16 November 2004|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The African assets were housed in Finagestion, a [[holding company]] 100% owned by the Bouygues Group.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://investir.lesechos.fr/actions/actualites/le-groupe-n-est-plus-majoritaire-dans-finagestion-apres-une-nouvelle-cession-de-participations-167339.php|title=Le groupe n'est plus majoritaire dans Finagestion après une nouvelle cession de participations|website=Investir|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Between July 2008 and October 2009, ECP FII Finagestion S.a.r.l., an affiliate of [[Emerging Capital Partners]] (ECP), gradually acquired a 60% stake in this entity from Bouygues.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/205056/economie/ecp-dans-le-capital-de-la-cie/|title=ECP dans le capital de la CIE|date=2009-02-18|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> ECP FII Finagestion S.a.r.l. currently owns 53.3% of the Eranove group.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Rapport-DD-Eranove-2017-LD.pdf|title=RAPPORT DE DÉVELOPPEMENT DURABLE 2017|date=2017|website=Eranove}}</ref> ECP gradually transformed Eranove (at the time Finagestion) into a pan-African industrial platform. The board of directors decided to rename Finagestion "Eranove" in July 2014 following a consultative process within the group's subsidiaries.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/4795/economie/eranove-a-t-il-assez-d-nergie-pour-devenir-un-leader-continental/|title=Eranove a-t-il assez d'énergie pour devenir un leader continental ?|date=2014-12-15|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Since 1960, the Eranove Group has been present in Côte d'Ivoire (Société de Distribution d'Eau de Côte d'Ivoire; Compagnie Ivoirienne d'électricité; Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'électricité; Awale). It began operations in Senegal in 1996 (Sénégalaise des Eaux). Since 2013, it is active in the Democratic Republic of Congo through a service contract with the Régidéso. The group is also developing other projects across Africa, notably in [[Mali]] (Kenié Renewable Energy<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/237608/economie/eranove-va-financer-le-barrage-de-kenie-au-mali/|title=Eranove va financer le barrage de Kenié au Mali|date=2015-06-18|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>), [[Gabon]] (Louetsi Hydro, Asokh Energy, Orélo<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gaboneco.com/energie-le-fgis-et-le-groupe-eranove-lancent-asokh-energy-et-louetsi-hydro.html|title=Energie : Le FGIS et le groupe Eranove lancent Asokh Energy et Louetsi (...)|website=Gaboneco|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>), [[Madagascar]] (Sahofika),<ref name=":5">{{Cite web|url=https://lenergeek.com/2016/12/06/eiffage-et-eranove-remportent-un-projet-de-centrale-a-madagascar/|title=Eiffage et Eranove remportent un méga projet de centrale hydroélectrique à Madagascar|date=2016-12-06|website=L'EnerGeek|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> Côte d'Ivoire (Atinkou and Cavally)<ref name=":6">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/354958/economie/eranove-va-construire-nouvelle-centrale-electrique-cote-divoire/|title=Eranove va construire une nouvelle centrale électrique en Côte d'Ivoire|date=2016-09-06|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> and [[Togo]] (Kékéli Efficient Power).<ref name=":7">{{Cite web|url=http://www.africainvestor.com/togo-is-set-to-develop-kekeli-efficient-power-station/|title=Togo is set to develop Kékéli Efficient Power station {{!}} Africa Investor|last=AiMedia|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

In the summer of 2015, the 18.6% still held by Bouygues were sold to French insurance company [[AXA]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://investir.lesechos.fr/actions/actualites/axa-acquiert-18-6-de-la-societe-africaine-eranove-aupres-de-bouygues-1079343.php|title=AXA acquiert 18,6% de la société africaine Eranove auprès de Bouygues|website=Investir|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

== Operations (through affiliates and service contracts) ==
=== CIPREL (Compagnie ivoirienne de production d'électricité) ===
A power generation company operating in Côte d'Ivoire since 1994,  CIPREL ({{ILL|Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'électricité|fr}}) has a thermal power plant consisting of seven [[gas turbine|combustion turbines]], which use [[natural gas]] extracted off the Ivorian coast as their main fuel, as well as a [[steam turbine]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://export.businessfrance.fr/Galerie/Files/Agenda/VA-CIPREL-et-AZITO-ENERGIE.pdf|title=Côte d'Ivoire - Abidjan|website=Business France}}</ref>

CIPREL operates a [[concession (contract)|concession]] contract, running until 2035, with the State of Côte d'Ivoire. It is 83.3% owned by Eranove.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.agenceecofin.com/production/1802-35986-ciprel-conforte-sa-place-de-premiere-centrale-de-cote-d-ivoire-avec-linauguration-dune-nouvelle-tranche-de-production|title=CIPREL conforte sa place de première centrale de Côte d'Ivoire avec l'inauguration d'une nouvelle tranche de production|last=Ecofin|first=Agence|website=Agence Ecofin|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

The entire CIPREL perimeter is HSE certified: [[ISO 9001]], [[OHSAS 18001]], ISO 14001. CIPREL has reached the confirmed stage of the ISO 26 000 standard for its commitment to [[corporate social responsibility]] (CSR) throughout its scope.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ecodafrik.com/ciprel-conforte-sa-place-de-premiere-centrale-de-cote-divoire-avec-linauguration/|title=CIPREL conforte sa place de première centrale de Côte d'Ivoire avec l'inauguration …|last=TAPSOBA|first=Mathurin|date=2016-02-19|website=ECODAFRIK|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

==== History ====
The company began its activities in March 1995 with CIPREL I (100 MW). The second 111 MW unit (CIPREL II) was commissioned in June 1997. Then in December 2009, 111 MW (CIPREL III) were commissioned, bringing the total production capacity to 321 MW.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://aip.ci/ciprel-iv-une-centrale-a-vapeur-innovante-et-ecologique-fiche-technique/|title=» CIPREL IV, une centrale à vapeur innovante et écologique (Fiche technique)|website=aip.ci|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

In December 2011, CIPREL was entrusted with a new extension to support Côte d'Ivoire's economic recovery, CIPREL IV.

CIPREL IV represents a total investment (including financing) of [[CFA franc|CFAF]] 222.9 billion (€339.8 million) for an additional 222 MW using combined cycle technology.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/17310/economie/c-te-d-ivoire-ciprel-r-colte-200-millions-d-euros/|title=Côte d'Ivoire : Ciprel récolte 200 millions d'euros|date=2013-08-21|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/420633.html|title=Avenant 6 à la convention Ciprel, La Côte d'Ivoire va augmenter sa production de 222 mégawatts|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> This fourth unit consists of a new 111 MW combustion turbine commissioned on 1 January 2014 and a 111 [[Watt|MW]] steam turbine.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/470673.html|title=Energie / Projet CIPREL IV : la Côte d'Ivoire obtient un prêt de 178 milliards de franc CFA.|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The steam turbine adds 111 MW of production capacity without additional natural gas consumption and thus avoids the release into the atmosphere of 500,000 tons of [[Carbon dioxide|{{CO2}}]] per year, while optimizing the cost of electricity production through improved thermal efficiency.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.financialafrik.com/2015/04/22/cote-divoire-ciprel-booste-loffre-electrique/|title=Côte d'Ivoire: Ciprel booste l'offre électrique|last=Rédaction|date=2015-04-22|website=Financial Afrik|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.linfodrome.com/economie/22360-abidjan-fourniture-de-l-electricite-3500-milliards-de-francs-cfa-d-investissement-prevus-de-2016-a-2020|title=Abidjan/ fourniture de l'électricité:3500 milliards de francs Cfa d'investissement prévus de 2016 à 2020|last=K.N|first=Hermance|date=2015-08-18|website=www.linfodrome.com|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Auxiliary works were completed at the end of 2015, making CIPREL IV's the largest gas-fired power plant in Côte d'Ivoire with a total production capacity of 556 MW and an estimated total annual production of 3,810 GWh.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://oxfordbusinessgroup.com/news/le-gouvernement-ivoirien-devrait-d%C3%A9passer-ses-objectifs-en-mati%C3%A8re-de-projets-%C3%A9nerg%C3%A9tiques|title=Le gouvernement ivoirien devrait dépasser ses objectifs en matière de projets énergétiques|date=2018-02-28|website=Oxford Business Group|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://intellivoire.net/la-cote-divoire-est-proche-de-conclure-un-accord-de-530-millions-pour-la-construction-dune-centrale-thermique/|title=La Côte d'Ivoire est proche de conclure un accord de 530 millions $ pour la construction d'une centrale thermique|last=dit|first=Noemie|date=2018-05-18|website=Intellivoire|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== CIE (Compagnie ivoirienne d’électricité) ===
CIE (Compagnie Ivoirienne d'Électricité) is a private operator linked to the State of Côte d'Ivoire by a concession agreement since 1990, to operate production, transmission and distribution facilities, and market, import and export on behalf of the Ivorian State of electricity throughout the national territory and in the wider region.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/485454.html|title=Kablan Duncan : " ...que l'énergie soit la lumière qui éclaire et accompagne l'émergence"|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> CIE serves 1.9 million customers, operates a production capacity of 704 MW as well as 50,000 km of the [[Electrical grid|electricity grid]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.financialafrik.com/2018/12/03/cote-divoire-le-centre-des-metiers-de-lelectricite-cme-obtient-98-de-reussite-au-bts-electrotechnique-2018/|title=CÔTE D'IVOIRE : Le Centre des Métiers de l'Électricité (CME) obtient 98% de réussite au BTS Électrotechnique 2018|last=Rédaction|date=2018-12-03|website=Financial Afrik|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Since the end of 2014, CIE has been implementing, in collaboration with the ministry, a program to facilitate access to electricity for the greatest number of people, the Electricity for All Program (Programme Électricité pour Tous - PEPT). It has connected 359,000 households to electricity.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.zonebourse.com%2FCOMPAGNIE-IVOIRIENNE-D-EL-16746059%2Fpdf%2F864407%2FCompagnie%2520Ivoirienne%2520d%2527Electricite%2520SA_Rapport-institutionnel.pdf|title=" Compagnie Ivoirienne d'Electricité "}}</ref>

CIE is listed on the Bourse régionale des valeurs mobilières ([[BRVM]]). It was rated AA+ (long-term) by the financial rating agency Bloomfield Investment in 2016 and is 55.53% owned by Eranove.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomfield-investment.com/portfolio/compagnie-ivoirienne-delectricite-cie-2018-fiche-de-notation-financiere/|title=Compagnie Ivoirienne d'Electricité [CIE] 2018 – Fiche de Notation Financière – Bloomfield Investment Corporation|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The scope of CIE's interconnected production, energy movements and transport are HSE certified according to ISO and OHSAS standards and have reached the confirmed stage according to ISO 26 000.<ref name=":1" />

Through CIE, the Eranove Group also operates the Centre des Métiers de l'Éléctricité (CME), a training center specializing in electricity and management based in [[Bingerville]], near [[Abidjan]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/emploi-formation/583173/cote-divoire-la-filiere-electricite-forme-ses-futurs-talents/|title=Côte d'Ivoire : la filière électricité forme ses futurs talents|date=2018-06-25|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The CME has obtained the HR Excellence certification and the "center of excellence" label from the Association of Power Utilities of Africa (APUA). In 2017, in addition to the 230 students in the BTS/DUT cycle, 4,416 people were enrolled in training and 220 in initial training.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://fr.allafrica.com/stories/201805040836.html|title=Cote d'Ivoire: Le Centre des Métiers de l'Electricité (CME) signe avec le Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers (CNAM) français et avec l'incubateur Jokkolabs|date=2018-05-04|website=allAfrica.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> In May 2018, the CME signed a partnership agreement with the [[Conservatoire national des arts et métiers|Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers]] (CNAM) to deliver the first French professional bachelor's degree of this kind in [[West Africa]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://aip.ci/cote-divoire-le-centre-de-formation-de-cie-va-delivrer-la-premiere-licence-professionnelle-du-cnam-francais-en-afrique-de-louest/|title=» Côte d'Ivoire/Le centre de formation de CIE va délivrer la première licence professionnelle du CNAM français en Afrique de l'Ouest|website=aip.ci|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== SODECI (Société de distribution d’eau de la Côte d'Ivoire) ===
Created in 1960 as the first privatized water distribution company in Africa, SODECI (Société de distribution d’eau de la Côte d'Ivoire [Côte d'Ivoire Water Distribution Company]) produces, transports and distributes clean drinking water in the urban areas of Côte d'Ivoire. Since 1999, SODECI also operates and maintains sanitation facilities for the city of [[Abidjan]]. SODECI provides services 1.1 million customers for water, while providing sanitation to 470,000 customers. SODECI operates through a lease contract.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/451159.html|title=M. Eba Basil, Directeur général de la Sodeci : Plus de manque d'eau d'ici à fin 2014 en Cote d'Ivoire|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

46.07% owned by Eranove, SODECI is a company listed on the Regional Transferable Securities Exchange (BRVM). SODECI was rated AA- (long-term) and A1- (short term by the financial rating agency Bloomfield Investments in 2016).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.brvm.org/sites/default/files/20161024_-_notation_financiere_-_sodeci_0.pdf|title=COTE D'IVOIRE, SOCIETE DE DISTRIBUTION D'EAU DE CÔTE D'IVOIRE (SODECI)|date=September 2016|website=Bloomfield Investment}}</ref> SODECI was the first private company in the public infrastructure spave in Africa to be certified ISO 9001.

=== SDE (Sénégalaise des eaux) ===
SDE, the Senegalese water company, has been producing, transporting and distributing drinking water in Senegal's main cities since 1996. SDE's lease contract with the State of Senegal has been renewed three times since 1996.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ppp.worldbank.org/public-private-partnership/multimedia/training/legal-enabling-environment/partenariat-public-prive-senegal|title=Partenariat Public-Prive, Cas de la Senegalaise des Eaux by Mamadou Dia {{!}} Public private partnership|website=ppp.worldbank.org|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/488513.html|title=Gouvernance de l'eau : Mamadou Dia partage les "clés" du succès du Sénégal avec ses pairs africains|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/197990/archives-thematique/mamadou-dia-240-milliards-de-f-cfa-ont-t-investis-entre-1996-et-2008/|title=Mamadou Dia : " 240 milliards de F CFA ont été investis entre 1996 et 2008 "|date=2010-03-22|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Between 1996 and 2017, the rate of access to the service increased from 80% to 98%, and the number of customers more than doubled (from 241,167 to 743,859).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.financialafrik.com/2018/03/22/journee-mondiale-de-leau-la-senegalaise-des-eaux-sde-a-double-sa-production-et-le-nombre-de-consommateurs/|title=Journée mondiale de l'eau : la Sénégalaise des Eaux (SDE) a doublé sa production et le nombre de consommateurs|last=Rédaction|date=2018-03-22|website=Financial Afrik|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref name=":2" /> Network efficiency increased by more than 10 points (1%). These performances have contributed to Senegal's achievement of the [[Millennium Development Goals]] (MDGs) in the field of drinking water services, along with other actors in the urban water sector.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://fr.allafrica.com/stories/201805220604.html|title=Afrique: La SDE désignée première société africaine d'eau de l'année|date=2018-05-22|website=allAfrica.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> SDE supplies consumers through individual connections and standpipes.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sde.sn/Pages/Presentation.aspx|title=Présentation|website=www.sde.sn|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> It had 1209 employees at the end of 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://fr.allafrica.com/stories/201803220666.html|title=Sénégal: La Sénégalaise Des Eaux (Sde) a doublé sa production et le nombre de consommateurs|date=2018-03-22|website=allAfrica.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

SDE is a member of the [[African Water Association]] (AAE), the International Water Association (IWA), the [[World Federation of Private Water Operators]] (AQUAFED) and the [[World Water Council]] (WWC).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.niameyetles2jours.com/l-uemoa/uemoa/2203-2056-journee-mondiale-de-l-eau-la-senegalaise-des-eaux-sde-a-double-sa-production-et-le-nombre-de-consommateurs|title=Journée mondiale de l'eau : la Sénégalaise des Eaux (SDE) a doublé sa production et le nombre de consommateurs|last=jours|first=Niamey et les 2|website=Niamey et les 2 jours|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> In 2018, SDE obtained the "Water Utility of the Year" award from African Utility Week.<ref name=":3" /> The SDE is QSE certified throughout its scope: ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001, ISO 14001. SDE has reached the exemplary stage of the ISO 26 000 standard for its commitment to corporate social responsibility (CSR).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iso.org/files/live/sites/isoorg/files/archive/pdf/en/2012_ebs-senegal_fr.pdf|title=Senegal|website=ISO}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iso.org/fr/news/2015/03/Ref1943.html|title=Les norms au service de l'eau en Africa|date=2015|website=ISO}}</ref>

Eranove and SDE, following an international bidding process, signed a three-year service contract, renewed in 2017, with REGIDESO (Democratic Republic of Congo), financed by the [[World Bank]].<ref name="jeuneafrique.com">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/20579/economie/rd-congo-finagestion-g-rera-l-eau-pendant-trois-ans/|title=RD Congo : Finagestion gérera l'eau pendant trois ans|date=2013-04-15|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== Smart Energy Côte d'Ivoire ===
An affiliate of CIE and the Eranove Group created in 2017, Smart Energy supports businesses in the attainment of their energy efficiency goals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.smartenergy.ci/|title=Smartenergy Côte d'Ivoire|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>{{peacock|date=November 2020}}

=== AWALE ===
AWALE (affiliate of CIE and the Eranove Group) is a company whose purpose is to furnish high-speed data transmission capacity via the electrical network of Côte d'Ivoire.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.awalecorp.ci/awale-corporation/nos-activites/|title=Nos activités|last=Bros|first=Creative Men|website=AWALE Corporation|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> In 2010, AWAL signed a 20-year agreement with the Côte d'Ivoire which grants it exclusive access to the national electric transportation and distribution network with the purpose of constructing and operating communication networks through [[Optical fiber|fiber optic]] lines and by on-line electric currents.<ref name=":8">{{Cite web|url=http://abidjanvilledurable.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/ERANOVE-plaquette-avril-2016.pdf|title=Eranove}}</ref> AWALE is 77.13% owned by Eranove (Eranove + CIE).<ref name=":8" />

== Projects under exclusive development ==
=== Kékéli Efficient Power ===
On October 23, 2018, the [[Republic of Togo]] and the Eranove Group signed a concession agreement for an electric power plant of 65 MW.<ref name=":7" /> The concession agreement for the production of electricity includes design, financing, construction, commissioning, operation and maintenance of an electric power plant located in the port district of [[Lomé]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://africaexclusive.net/togo-eranove/|title=CENTRALE ELECTRIQUE DE KEKELI {{!}} Le Togo signe avec Eranove|date=2018-10-25|website=Africa Exclusive|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== Atinkou ===
On September 5, 2016, the Eranove Group signed an agreement protocol with Côte d'Ivoire for the financing, design, construction, operation and maintenance of a thermal combined cycle power plant of 390 MW, followed by the signing of a concession agreement on 19 December 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/expertises/economiser-les-ressources/|title=Économiser les ressources|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.agenceecofin.com/production/2012-62810-letat-de-cote-divoire-et-le-groupe-eranove-signent-une-convention-de-concession-pour-une-centrale-electrique-de-390-mw|title=L'État de Côte d'Ivoire et le Groupe Eranove signent une convention de concession pour une centrale électrique de 390 MW|last=ERANOVE|website=Agence Ecofin|language=fr-fr|access-date=2019-01-07}}</ref> The Atinkou power plant will use natural gas as its main fuel and will be located on the edge of Abidjan.<ref name=":6" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.afrik21.africa/en/ivory-coast-eranove-wraps-up-financing-for-its-390-mw-power-plant-atinkou/|title = IVORY COAST: Eranove wraps up financing for its 390 MW power plant, Atinkou|date = 10 March 2020}}</ref>

=== Orélo ===
In October 2018, the signing of the concession agreement for the Orélo water treatment plant followed the agreement protocol signed in March 2017 by the Republic of Gabon, the FGIS and the Eranove Group.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/le-fonds-gabonais-dinvestissements-strategiques-fgis-et-le-groupe-eranove-signent-trois-contrats-avec-la-republique-gabonaise/|title=Le Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) et le Groupe Eranove signent trois contrats avec la République Gabonaise|date=2018-10-26|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> This contract deals with the financing, design, construction, operation and maintenance of a new clean drinking water production plant with a production capacity of 140,000 m3 per day, situated in the [[Estuaire Province]], more specifically in the district of Komo-Kango.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.hydroworld.com/articles/2018/11/gabon-to-develop-two-hydro-plants-water-production-unit.html|title=Gabon to develop two hydro plants, water production unit|website=www.hydroworld.com|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== Kenié Énergie Renouvelable ===
Through its affiliate Kénié Énergie Renouvelable (Kénié Renewable Energy), the Eranove Group signed on June 18, 2015, with the government of the Republic of Mali a concession agreement with a duration of 30 years for the financing, design, construction and operation of the 42MW Kénié hydroelectric power plant, 35 km east of Bamako in Baguinéda on the [[Niger River]].<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.agenceecofin.com/hydroelectricite/1806-29910-eranove-s-engage-dans-l-energie-hydroelectrique-au-mali|title=Eranove s'engage dans l'énergie hydroélectrique au Mali|last=Ecofin|first=Agence|website=Agence Ecofin|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.waterpowermagazine.com/news/newseranove-to-develop-42mw-hydro-plant-in-mali-4606125|title=Eranove to develop 42MW hydro plant in Mali - International Water Power|website=www.waterpowermagazine.com|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== Asokh Energy ===
On 21 October 2016, the Eranove Group and the Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) signed a concession contract with the Gabonese State for the design, financing, construction and operation of the Asokh Energy hydroelectric power plant (Ngoulmendjim site, 73 MW) on 26 October 2018.<ref name=":9">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/655132/economie/eau-et-electricite-eranove-obtient-des-marches-au-gabon-et-au-togo/|title=Eau et électricité : Eranove obtient des marchés au Gabon et au Togo|date=2018-10-29|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> This hydroelectric power plant, located on the [[Komo River]], is going  to supply Libreville.<ref name=":10">{{Cite web|url=http://reussirbusiness.com/actualites/deficit-electricite-gabon-les-societes-asokh-energy-et-louetsi-hydro-comme-solution/|title=Déficit électricité Gabon : Les sociétés Asokh Energy et Louetsi Hydro comme solution|date=2018-05-15|website=La référence du Business au Sénégal|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== Louetsi Energy ===
On 21 October 2016, the Eranove group and the Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) signed a concession contract with the Gabonese State for the design, financing, construction and operation of the Louetsi Hydro (15 MW) [[Hydroelectricity|hydroelectric power plant]] and on 26 October 2018, the contract for the sale of electricity.<ref name=":9" /> This run-of-river hydroelectric power plant, located 450 km from the capital on the [[Louetsié River|Louetsi River]], on the Dibwangui site, is dedicated to supplying the southwestern part of the country.<ref name=":10" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/afrique/louetsi-energy/|title=Louetsi Energy|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2019-01-07}}</ref>

=== Cavally ===
In 2014 the Eranove Group signed an agreement protocol related to hydroelectric planning for the [[Cavalla River|Cavally River]]. This protocol commits Eranove to the design, financing, construction and operation of hydroelectric facilities on the Cavally River, within the framework of a BOO (Build-Own-Operate) contract.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/afrique/|title=Afrique|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

=== Sahofika ===
A consortium made up of the Eranove, Eiffage and Themis Groups on December 2, 2016, signed a project agreement with the Republic of Madagascar for the construction and operation of a 200 MW capacity hydroelectric power plant.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lexpressmada.com/06/07/2018/energie-la-future-centrale-de-sahofika-sort-de-leau/|title=Energie - La future centrale de Sahofika sort de l'eau • L'Express de Madagascar|last=Rakotobe|first=Harilalaina|date=2018-07-06|website=L'Express de Madagascar|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref name=":5" />

=== RSE ===
Through its subsidiaries, the group is committed to all the facets of ISO 26 000 CSR and to ISO 9001 quality, OHSAS 18001 safety and ISO 1400160 environmental certification.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fr.africanews.com/2018/10/23/la-republique-togolaise-et-le-groupe-eranove-signent-une-convention-de-concession-pour-une-centrale-electrique-de-65mw/|title=La République Togolaise et le Groupe Eranove signent une convention de concession pour une centrale électrique de 65MW|last=AfricaNews|date=2018-10-23|website=Africanews|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

contentMetadata.text: Eranove is a French company active in the management of public services and in the production of electricity and drinking water in Africa. The company was formerly known as Finagestion. The Eranove Group has been present in Côte d'Ivoire (SODECI [fr], Compagnie ivoirienne d'électricité [fr], Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'Electricite [fr], AWALE and SMART ENERGY) for several decades, in Senegal (SDE) since 1996, and in the Democratic Republic of Congo since 2012 (service contract with Regideso). The group has also been developing projects in Mali since 2015 (Kénié Énergie Renouvelable), Gabon (Louetsi Hydro, Asokh Energy, Orélo), Madagascar (Sahofika), and Togo (Kékéli Efficient Power). It generated revenues of €576 million in 2017. Eranove operates an installed capacity of more than 1,250 MW. The group employs more than 9,000 people and serves 1.9 million customers for electricity, 1.8 million for water and 470,000 for sanitation. The majority shareholder of the Eranove Group is ECP Finagestion FII S.a.r.l., affiliated with Emerging Capital Partners, a private equity firm. Between 2005 and 2006, the Bouygues Group sold its public services subsidiary, Saur, while retaining its African and Italian assets. The African assets were housed in Finagestion, a holding company 100% owned by the Bouygues Group. Between July 2008 and October 2009, ECP FII Finagestion S.a.r.l., an affiliate of Emerging Capital Partners (ECP), gradually acquired a 60% stake in this entity from Bouygues. ECP FII Finagestion S.a.r.l. currently owns 53.3% of the Eranove group. ECP gradually transformed Eranove (at the time Finagestion) into a pan-African industrial platform. The board of directors decided to rename Finagestion "Eranove" in July 2014 following a consultative process within the group's subsidiaries. Since 1960, the Eranove Group has been present in Côte d'Ivoire (Société de Distribution d'Eau de Côte d'Ivoire; Compagnie Ivoirienne d'électricité; Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'électricité; Awale). It began operations in Senegal in 1996 (Sénégalaise des Eaux). Since 2013, it is active in the Democratic Republic of Congo through a service contract with the Régidéso. The group is also developing other projects across Africa, notably in Mali (Kenié Renewable Energy), Gabon (Louetsi Hydro, Asokh Energy, Orélo), Madagascar (Sahofika), Côte d'Ivoire (Atinkou and Cavally) and Togo (Kékéli Efficient Power). In the summer of 2015, the 18.6% still held by Bouygues were sold to French insurance company AXA. A power generation company operating in Côte d'Ivoire since 1994, CIPREL (Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'électricité [fr]) has a thermal power plant consisting of seven combustion turbines, which use natural gas extracted off the Ivorian coast as their main fuel, as well as a steam turbine. CIPREL operates a concession contract, running until 2035, with the State of Côte d'Ivoire. It is 83.3% owned by Eranove. The entire CIPREL perimeter is HSE certified: ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001, ISO 14001. CIPREL has reached the confirmed stage of the ISO 26 000 standard for its commitment to corporate social responsibility (CSR) throughout its scope. The company began its activities in March 1995 with CIPREL I (100 MW). The second 111 MW unit (CIPREL II) was commissioned in June 1997. Then in December 2009, 111 MW (CIPREL III) were commissioned, bringing the total production capacity to 321 MW. In December 2011, CIPREL was entrusted with a new extension to support Côte d'Ivoire's economic recovery, CIPREL IV. CIPREL IV represents a total investment (including financing) of CFAF 222.9 billion (€339.8 million) for an additional 222 MW using combined cycle technology. This fourth unit consists of a new 111 MW combustion turbine commissioned on 1 January 2014 and a 111 MW steam turbine. The steam turbine adds 111 MW of production capacity without additional natural gas consumption and thus avoids the release into the atmosphere of 500,000 tons of CO2 per year, while optimizing the cost of electricity production through improved thermal efficiency. Auxiliary works were completed at the end of 2015, making CIPREL IV's the largest gas-fired power plant in Côte d'Ivoire with a total production capacity of 556 MW and an estimated total annual production of 3,810 GWh. CIE (Compagnie Ivoirienne d'Électricité) is a private operator linked to the State of Côte d'Ivoire by a concession agreement since 1990, to operate production, transmission and distribution facilities, and market, import and export on behalf of the Ivorian State of electricity throughout the national territory and in the wider region. CIE serves 1.9 million customers, operates a production capacity of 704 MW as well as 50,000 km of the electricity grid. Since the end of 2014, CIE has been implementing, in collaboration with the ministry, a program to facilitate access to electricity for the greatest number of people, the Electricity for All Program (Programme Électricité pour Tous - PEPT). It has connected 359,000 households to electricity. CIE is listed on the Bourse régionale des valeurs mobilières (BRVM). It was rated AA+ (long-term) by the financial rating agency Bloomfield Investment in 2016 and is 55.53% owned by Eranove. The scope of CIE's interconnected production, energy movements and transport are HSE certified according to ISO and OHSAS standards and have reached the confirmed stage according to ISO 26 000. Through CIE, the Eranove Group also operates the Centre des Métiers de l'Éléctricité (CME), a training center specializing in electricity and management based in Bingerville, near Abidjan. The CME has obtained the HR Excellence certification and the "center of excellence" label from the Association of Power Utilities of Africa (APUA). In 2017, in addition to the 230 students in the BTS/DUT cycle, 4,416 people were enrolled in training and 220 in initial training. In May 2018, the CME signed a partnership agreement with the Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers (CNAM) to deliver the first French professional bachelor's degree of this kind in West Africa. Created in 1960 as the first privatized water distribution company in Africa, SODECI (Société de distribution d’eau de la Côte d'Ivoire [Côte d'Ivoire Water Distribution Company]) produces, transports and distributes clean drinking water in the urban areas of Côte d'Ivoire. Since 1999, SODECI also operates and maintains sanitation facilities for the city of Abidjan. SODECI provides services 1.1 million customers for water, while providing sanitation to 470,000 customers. SODECI operates through a lease contract. 46.07% owned by Eranove, SODECI is a company listed on the Regional Transferable Securities Exchange (BRVM). SODECI was rated AA- (long-term) and A1- (short term by the financial rating agency Bloomfield Investments in 2016). SODECI was the first private company in the public infrastructure spave in Africa to be certified ISO 9001. SDE, the Senegalese water company, has been producing, transporting and distributing drinking water in Senegal's main cities since 1996. SDE's lease contract with the State of Senegal has been renewed three times since 1996. Between 1996 and 2017, the rate of access to the service increased from 80% to 98%, and the number of customers more than doubled (from 241,167 to 743,859). Network efficiency increased by more than 10 points (1%). These performances have contributed to Senegal's achievement of the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) in the field of drinking water services, along with other actors in the urban water sector. SDE supplies consumers through individual connections and standpipes. It had 1209 employees at the end of 2017. SDE is a member of the African Water Association (AAE), the International Water Association (IWA), the World Federation of Private Water Operators (AQUAFED) and the World Water Council (WWC). In 2018, SDE obtained the "Water Utility of the Year" award from African Utility Week. The SDE is QSE certified throughout its scope: ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001, ISO 14001. SDE has reached the exemplary stage of the ISO 26 000 standard for its commitment to corporate social responsibility (CSR). Eranove and SDE, following an international bidding process, signed a three-year service contract, renewed in 2017, with REGIDESO (Democratic Republic of Congo), financed by the World Bank. An affiliate of CIE and the Eranove Group created in 2017, Smart Energy supports businesses in the attainment of their energy efficiency goals. AWALE (affiliate of CIE and the Eranove Group) is a company whose purpose is to furnish high-speed data transmission capacity via the electrical network of Côte d'Ivoire. In 2010, AWAL signed a 20-year agreement with the Côte d'Ivoire which grants it exclusive access to the national electric transportation and distribution network with the purpose of constructing and operating communication networks through fiber optic lines and by on-line electric currents. AWALE is 77.13% owned by Eranove (Eranove + CIE). On October 23, 2018, the Republic of Togo and the Eranove Group signed a concession agreement for an electric power plant of 65 MW. The concession agreement for the production of electricity includes design, financing, construction, commissioning, operation and maintenance of an electric power plant located in the port district of Lomé. On September 5, 2016, the Eranove Group signed an agreement protocol with Côte d'Ivoire for the financing, design, construction, operation and maintenance of a thermal combined cycle power plant of 390 MW, followed by the signing of a concession agreement on 19 December 2018. The Atinkou power plant will use natural gas as its main fuel and will be located on the edge of Abidjan. In October 2018, the signing of the concession agreement for the Orélo water treatment plant followed the agreement protocol signed in March 2017 by the Republic of Gabon, the FGIS and the Eranove Group. This contract deals with the financing, design, construction, operation and maintenance of a new clean drinking water production plant with a production capacity of 140,000 m3 per day, situated in the Estuaire Province, more specifically in the district of Komo-Kango. Through its affiliate Kénié Énergie Renouvelable (Kénié Renewable Energy), the Eranove Group signed on June 18, 2015, with the government of the Republic of Mali a concession agreement with a duration of 30 years for the financing, design, construction and operation of the 42MW Kénié hydroelectric power plant, 35 km east of Bamako in Baguinéda on the Niger River. On 21 October 2016, the Eranove Group and the Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) signed a concession contract with the Gabonese State for the design, financing, construction and operation of the Asokh Energy hydroelectric power plant (Ngoulmendjim site, 73 MW) on 26 October 2018. This hydroelectric power plant, located on the Komo River, is going to supply Libreville. On 21 October 2016, the Eranove group and the Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) signed a concession contract with the Gabonese State for the design, financing, construction and operation of the Louetsi Hydro (15 MW) hydroelectric power plant and on 26 October 2018, the contract for the sale of electricity. This run-of-river hydroelectric power plant, located 450 km from the capital on the Louetsi River, on the Dibwangui site, is dedicated to supplying the southwestern part of the country. In 2014 the Eranove Group signed an agreement protocol related to hydroelectric planning for the Cavally River. This protocol commits Eranove to the design, financing, construction and operation of hydroelectric facilities on the Cavally River, within the framework of a BOO (Build-Own-Operate) contract. A consortium made up of the Eranove, Eiffage and Themis Groups on December 2, 2016, signed a project agreement with the Republic of Madagascar for the construction and operation of a 200 MW capacity hydroelectric power plant. Through its subsidiaries, the group is committed to all the facets of ISO 26 000 CSR and to ISO 9001 quality, OHSAS 18001 safety and ISO 1400160 environmental certification. texts.title: History
texts.value:
Between 2005 and 2006, the [[Bouygues|Bouygues Group]] sold its public services subsidiary, [[Saur (company)|Saur]], while retaining its African and Italian assets.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lesechos.fr/16/11/2004/LesEchos/19286-108-ECH_bouygues-boucle-la-vente-pour-1-037-milliard-d-euros-de-la-saur.htm|title=Bouygues boucle la vente pour 1,037 milliard d'euros de la SAUR|website=lesechos.fr|date=16 November 2004|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The African assets were housed in Finagestion, a [[holding company]] 100% owned by the Bouygues Group.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://investir.lesechos.fr/actions/actualites/le-groupe-n-est-plus-majoritaire-dans-finagestion-apres-une-nouvelle-cession-de-participations-167339.php|title=Le groupe n'est plus majoritaire dans Finagestion après une nouvelle cession de participations|website=Investir|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Between July 2008 and October 2009, ECP FII Finagestion S.a.r.l., an affiliate of [[Emerging Capital Partners]] (ECP), gradually acquired a 60% stake in this entity from Bouygues.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/205056/economie/ecp-dans-le-capital-de-la-cie/|title=ECP dans le capital de la CIE|date=2009-02-18|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> ECP FII Finagestion S.a.r.l. currently owns 53.3% of the Eranove group.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Rapport-DD-Eranove-2017-LD.pdf|title=RAPPORT DE DÉVELOPPEMENT DURABLE 2017|date=2017|website=Eranove}}</ref> ECP gradually transformed Eranove (at the time Finagestion) into a pan-African industrial platform. The board of directors decided to rename Finagestion "Eranove" in July 2014 following a consultative process within the group's subsidiaries.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/4795/economie/eranove-a-t-il-assez-d-nergie-pour-devenir-un-leader-continental/|title=Eranove a-t-il assez d'énergie pour devenir un leader continental ?|date=2014-12-15|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Since 1960, the Eranove Group has been present in Côte d'Ivoire (Société de Distribution d'Eau de Côte d'Ivoire; Compagnie Ivoirienne d'électricité; Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'électricité; Awale). It began operations in Senegal in 1996 (Sénégalaise des Eaux). Since 2013, it is active in the Democratic Republic of Congo through a service contract with the Régidéso. The group is also developing other projects across Africa, notably in [[Mali]] (Kenié Renewable Energy<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/237608/economie/eranove-va-financer-le-barrage-de-kenie-au-mali/|title=Eranove va financer le barrage de Kenié au Mali|date=2015-06-18|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>), [[Gabon]] (Louetsi Hydro, Asokh Energy, Orélo<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gaboneco.com/energie-le-fgis-et-le-groupe-eranove-lancent-asokh-energy-et-louetsi-hydro.html|title=Energie : Le FGIS et le groupe Eranove lancent Asokh Energy et Louetsi (...)|website=Gaboneco|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>), [[Madagascar]] (Sahofika),<ref name=":5">{{Cite web|url=https://lenergeek.com/2016/12/06/eiffage-et-eranove-remportent-un-projet-de-centrale-a-madagascar/|title=Eiffage et Eranove remportent un méga projet de centrale hydroélectrique à Madagascar|date=2016-12-06|website=L'EnerGeek|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> Côte d'Ivoire (Atinkou and Cavally)<ref name=":6">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/354958/economie/eranove-va-construire-nouvelle-centrale-electrique-cote-divoire/|title=Eranove va construire une nouvelle centrale électrique en Côte d'Ivoire|date=2016-09-06|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> and [[Togo]] (Kékéli Efficient Power).<ref name=":7">{{Cite web|url=http://www.africainvestor.com/togo-is-set-to-develop-kekeli-efficient-power-station/|title=Togo is set to develop Kékéli Efficient Power station {{!}} Africa Investor|last=AiMedia|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

In the summer of 2015, the 18.6% still held by Bouygues were sold to French insurance company [[AXA]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://investir.lesechos.fr/actions/actualites/axa-acquiert-18-6-de-la-societe-africaine-eranove-aupres-de-bouygues-1079343.php|title=AXA acquiert 18,6% de la société africaine Eranove auprès de Bouygues|website=Investir|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: CIPREL (Compagnie ivoirienne de production d'électricité)
texts.value:
A power generation company operating in Côte d'Ivoire since 1994,  CIPREL ({{ILL|Compagnie Ivoirienne de Production d'électricité|fr}}) has a thermal power plant consisting of seven [[gas turbine|combustion turbines]], which use [[natural gas]] extracted off the Ivorian coast as their main fuel, as well as a [[steam turbine]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://export.businessfrance.fr/Galerie/Files/Agenda/VA-CIPREL-et-AZITO-ENERGIE.pdf|title=Côte d'Ivoire - Abidjan|website=Business France}}</ref>

CIPREL operates a [[concession (contract)|concession]] contract, running until 2035, with the State of Côte d'Ivoire. It is 83.3% owned by Eranove.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.agenceecofin.com/production/1802-35986-ciprel-conforte-sa-place-de-premiere-centrale-de-cote-d-ivoire-avec-linauguration-dune-nouvelle-tranche-de-production|title=CIPREL conforte sa place de première centrale de Côte d'Ivoire avec l'inauguration d'une nouvelle tranche de production|last=Ecofin|first=Agence|website=Agence Ecofin|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

The entire CIPREL perimeter is HSE certified: [[ISO 9001]], [[OHSAS 18001]], ISO 14001. CIPREL has reached the confirmed stage of the ISO 26 000 standard for its commitment to [[corporate social responsibility]] (CSR) throughout its scope.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ecodafrik.com/ciprel-conforte-sa-place-de-premiere-centrale-de-cote-divoire-avec-linauguration/|title=CIPREL conforte sa place de première centrale de Côte d'Ivoire avec l'inauguration …|last=TAPSOBA|first=Mathurin|date=2016-02-19|website=ECODAFRIK|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: History
texts.value:
The company began its activities in March 1995 with CIPREL I (100 MW). The second 111 MW unit (CIPREL II) was commissioned in June 1997. Then in December 2009, 111 MW (CIPREL III) were commissioned, bringing the total production capacity to 321 MW.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://aip.ci/ciprel-iv-une-centrale-a-vapeur-innovante-et-ecologique-fiche-technique/|title=» CIPREL IV, une centrale à vapeur innovante et écologique (Fiche technique)|website=aip.ci|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

In December 2011, CIPREL was entrusted with a new extension to support Côte d'Ivoire's economic recovery, CIPREL IV.

CIPREL IV represents a total investment (including financing) of [[CFA franc|CFAF]] 222.9 billion (€339.8 million) for an additional 222 MW using combined cycle technology.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/17310/economie/c-te-d-ivoire-ciprel-r-colte-200-millions-d-euros/|title=Côte d'Ivoire : Ciprel récolte 200 millions d'euros|date=2013-08-21|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/420633.html|title=Avenant 6 à la convention Ciprel, La Côte d'Ivoire va augmenter sa production de 222 mégawatts|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> This fourth unit consists of a new 111 MW combustion turbine commissioned on 1 January 2014 and a 111 [[Watt|MW]] steam turbine.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/470673.html|title=Energie / Projet CIPREL IV : la Côte d'Ivoire obtient un prêt de 178 milliards de franc CFA.|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The steam turbine adds 111 MW of production capacity without additional natural gas consumption and thus avoids the release into the atmosphere of 500,000 tons of [[Carbon dioxide|{{CO2}}]] per year, while optimizing the cost of electricity production through improved thermal efficiency.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.financialafrik.com/2015/04/22/cote-divoire-ciprel-booste-loffre-electrique/|title=Côte d'Ivoire: Ciprel booste l'offre électrique|last=Rédaction|date=2015-04-22|website=Financial Afrik|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.linfodrome.com/economie/22360-abidjan-fourniture-de-l-electricite-3500-milliards-de-francs-cfa-d-investissement-prevus-de-2016-a-2020|title=Abidjan/ fourniture de l'électricité:3500 milliards de francs Cfa d'investissement prévus de 2016 à 2020|last=K.N|first=Hermance|date=2015-08-18|website=www.linfodrome.com|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Auxiliary works were completed at the end of 2015, making CIPREL IV's the largest gas-fired power plant in Côte d'Ivoire with a total production capacity of 556 MW and an estimated total annual production of 3,810 GWh.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://oxfordbusinessgroup.com/news/le-gouvernement-ivoirien-devrait-d%C3%A9passer-ses-objectifs-en-mati%C3%A8re-de-projets-%C3%A9nerg%C3%A9tiques|title=Le gouvernement ivoirien devrait dépasser ses objectifs en matière de projets énergétiques|date=2018-02-28|website=Oxford Business Group|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://intellivoire.net/la-cote-divoire-est-proche-de-conclure-un-accord-de-530-millions-pour-la-construction-dune-centrale-thermique/|title=La Côte d'Ivoire est proche de conclure un accord de 530 millions $ pour la construction d'une centrale thermique|last=dit|first=Noemie|date=2018-05-18|website=Intellivoire|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: CIE (Compagnie ivoirienne d’électricité)
texts.value:
CIE (Compagnie Ivoirienne d'Électricité) is a private operator linked to the State of Côte d'Ivoire by a concession agreement since 1990, to operate production, transmission and distribution facilities, and market, import and export on behalf of the Ivorian State of electricity throughout the national territory and in the wider region.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/485454.html|title=Kablan Duncan : " ...que l'énergie soit la lumière qui éclaire et accompagne l'émergence"|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> CIE serves 1.9 million customers, operates a production capacity of 704 MW as well as 50,000 km of the [[Electrical grid|electricity grid]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.financialafrik.com/2018/12/03/cote-divoire-le-centre-des-metiers-de-lelectricite-cme-obtient-98-de-reussite-au-bts-electrotechnique-2018/|title=CÔTE D'IVOIRE : Le Centre des Métiers de l'Électricité (CME) obtient 98% de réussite au BTS Électrotechnique 2018|last=Rédaction|date=2018-12-03|website=Financial Afrik|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Since the end of 2014, CIE has been implementing, in collaboration with the ministry, a program to facilitate access to electricity for the greatest number of people, the Electricity for All Program (Programme Électricité pour Tous - PEPT). It has connected 359,000 households to electricity.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.zonebourse.com%2FCOMPAGNIE-IVOIRIENNE-D-EL-16746059%2Fpdf%2F864407%2FCompagnie%2520Ivoirienne%2520d%2527Electricite%2520SA_Rapport-institutionnel.pdf|title=" Compagnie Ivoirienne d'Electricité "}}</ref>

CIE is listed on the Bourse régionale des valeurs mobilières ([[BRVM]]). It was rated AA+ (long-term) by the financial rating agency Bloomfield Investment in 2016 and is 55.53% owned by Eranove.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomfield-investment.com/portfolio/compagnie-ivoirienne-delectricite-cie-2018-fiche-de-notation-financiere/|title=Compagnie Ivoirienne d'Electricité [CIE] 2018 – Fiche de Notation Financière – Bloomfield Investment Corporation|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The scope of CIE's interconnected production, energy movements and transport are HSE certified according to ISO and OHSAS standards and have reached the confirmed stage according to ISO 26 000.<ref name=":1" />

Through CIE, the Eranove Group also operates the Centre des Métiers de l'Éléctricité (CME), a training center specializing in electricity and management based in [[Bingerville]], near [[Abidjan]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/emploi-formation/583173/cote-divoire-la-filiere-electricite-forme-ses-futurs-talents/|title=Côte d'Ivoire : la filière électricité forme ses futurs talents|date=2018-06-25|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> The CME has obtained the HR Excellence certification and the "center of excellence" label from the Association of Power Utilities of Africa (APUA). In 2017, in addition to the 230 students in the BTS/DUT cycle, 4,416 people were enrolled in training and 220 in initial training.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://fr.allafrica.com/stories/201805040836.html|title=Cote d'Ivoire: Le Centre des Métiers de l'Electricité (CME) signe avec le Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers (CNAM) français et avec l'incubateur Jokkolabs|date=2018-05-04|website=allAfrica.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> In May 2018, the CME signed a partnership agreement with the [[Conservatoire national des arts et métiers|Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers]] (CNAM) to deliver the first French professional bachelor's degree of this kind in [[West Africa]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://aip.ci/cote-divoire-le-centre-de-formation-de-cie-va-delivrer-la-premiere-licence-professionnelle-du-cnam-francais-en-afrique-de-louest/|title=» Côte d'Ivoire/Le centre de formation de CIE va délivrer la première licence professionnelle du CNAM français en Afrique de l'Ouest|website=aip.ci|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: SODECI (Société de distribution d’eau de la Côte d'Ivoire)
texts.value:
Created in 1960 as the first privatized water distribution company in Africa, SODECI (Société de distribution d’eau de la Côte d'Ivoire [Côte d'Ivoire Water Distribution Company]) produces, transports and distributes clean drinking water in the urban areas of Côte d'Ivoire. Since 1999, SODECI also operates and maintains sanitation facilities for the city of [[Abidjan]]. SODECI provides services 1.1 million customers for water, while providing sanitation to 470,000 customers. SODECI operates through a lease contract.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/451159.html|title=M. Eba Basil, Directeur général de la Sodeci : Plus de manque d'eau d'ici à fin 2014 en Cote d'Ivoire|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

46.07% owned by Eranove, SODECI is a company listed on the Regional Transferable Securities Exchange (BRVM). SODECI was rated AA- (long-term) and A1- (short term by the financial rating agency Bloomfield Investments in 2016).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.brvm.org/sites/default/files/20161024_-_notation_financiere_-_sodeci_0.pdf|title=COTE D'IVOIRE, SOCIETE DE DISTRIBUTION D'EAU DE CÔTE D'IVOIRE (SODECI)|date=September 2016|website=Bloomfield Investment}}</ref> SODECI was the first private company in the public infrastructure spave in Africa to be certified ISO 9001.

texts.title: SDE (Sénégalaise des eaux)
texts.value:
SDE, the Senegalese water company, has been producing, transporting and distributing drinking water in Senegal's main cities since 1996. SDE's lease contract with the State of Senegal has been renewed three times since 1996.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ppp.worldbank.org/public-private-partnership/multimedia/training/legal-enabling-environment/partenariat-public-prive-senegal|title=Partenariat Public-Prive, Cas de la Senegalaise des Eaux by Mamadou Dia {{!}} Public private partnership|website=ppp.worldbank.org|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.abidjan.net/h/488513.html|title=Gouvernance de l'eau : Mamadou Dia partage les "clés" du succès du Sénégal avec ses pairs africains|website=Abidjan.net|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/197990/archives-thematique/mamadou-dia-240-milliards-de-f-cfa-ont-t-investis-entre-1996-et-2008/|title=Mamadou Dia : " 240 milliards de F CFA ont été investis entre 1996 et 2008 "|date=2010-03-22|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

Between 1996 and 2017, the rate of access to the service increased from 80% to 98%, and the number of customers more than doubled (from 241,167 to 743,859).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.financialafrik.com/2018/03/22/journee-mondiale-de-leau-la-senegalaise-des-eaux-sde-a-double-sa-production-et-le-nombre-de-consommateurs/|title=Journée mondiale de l'eau : la Sénégalaise des Eaux (SDE) a doublé sa production et le nombre de consommateurs|last=Rédaction|date=2018-03-22|website=Financial Afrik|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref name=":2" /> Network efficiency increased by more than 10 points (1%). These performances have contributed to Senegal's achievement of the [[Millennium Development Goals]] (MDGs) in the field of drinking water services, along with other actors in the urban water sector.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://fr.allafrica.com/stories/201805220604.html|title=Afrique: La SDE désignée première société africaine d'eau de l'année|date=2018-05-22|website=allAfrica.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> SDE supplies consumers through individual connections and standpipes.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sde.sn/Pages/Presentation.aspx|title=Présentation|website=www.sde.sn|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> It had 1209 employees at the end of 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://fr.allafrica.com/stories/201803220666.html|title=Sénégal: La Sénégalaise Des Eaux (Sde) a doublé sa production et le nombre de consommateurs|date=2018-03-22|website=allAfrica.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

SDE is a member of the [[African Water Association]] (AAE), the International Water Association (IWA), the [[World Federation of Private Water Operators]] (AQUAFED) and the [[World Water Council]] (WWC).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.niameyetles2jours.com/l-uemoa/uemoa/2203-2056-journee-mondiale-de-l-eau-la-senegalaise-des-eaux-sde-a-double-sa-production-et-le-nombre-de-consommateurs|title=Journée mondiale de l'eau : la Sénégalaise des Eaux (SDE) a doublé sa production et le nombre de consommateurs|last=jours|first=Niamey et les 2|website=Niamey et les 2 jours|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> In 2018, SDE obtained the "Water Utility of the Year" award from African Utility Week.<ref name=":3" /> The SDE is QSE certified throughout its scope: ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001, ISO 14001. SDE has reached the exemplary stage of the ISO 26 000 standard for its commitment to corporate social responsibility (CSR).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iso.org/files/live/sites/isoorg/files/archive/pdf/en/2012_ebs-senegal_fr.pdf|title=Senegal|website=ISO}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iso.org/fr/news/2015/03/Ref1943.html|title=Les norms au service de l'eau en Africa|date=2015|website=ISO}}</ref>

Eranove and SDE, following an international bidding process, signed a three-year service contract, renewed in 2017, with REGIDESO (Democratic Republic of Congo), financed by the [[World Bank]].<ref name="jeuneafrique.com">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/20579/economie/rd-congo-finagestion-g-rera-l-eau-pendant-trois-ans/|title=RD Congo : Finagestion gérera l'eau pendant trois ans|date=2013-04-15|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: Smart Energy Côte d'Ivoire
texts.value: An affiliate of CIE and the Eranove Group created in 2017, Smart Energy supports businesses in the attainment of their energy efficiency goals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.smartenergy.ci/|title=Smartenergy Côte d'Ivoire|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>{{peacock|date=November 2020}}

texts.title: AWALE
texts.value: AWALE (affiliate of CIE and the Eranove Group) is a company whose purpose is to furnish high-speed data transmission capacity via the electrical network of Côte d'Ivoire.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.awalecorp.ci/awale-corporation/nos-activites/|title=Nos activités|last=Bros|first=Creative Men|website=AWALE Corporation|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> In 2010, AWAL signed a 20-year agreement with the Côte d'Ivoire which grants it exclusive access to the national electric transportation and distribution network with the purpose of constructing and operating communication networks through [[Optical fiber|fiber optic]] lines and by on-line electric currents.<ref name=":8">{{Cite web|url=http://abidjanvilledurable.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/ERANOVE-plaquette-avril-2016.pdf|title=Eranove}}</ref> AWALE is 77.13% owned by Eranove (Eranove + CIE).<ref name=":8" />

texts.title: Kékéli Efficient Power
texts.value: On October 23, 2018, the [[Republic of Togo]] and the Eranove Group signed a concession agreement for an electric power plant of 65 MW.<ref name=":7" /> The concession agreement for the production of electricity includes design, financing, construction, commissioning, operation and maintenance of an electric power plant located in the port district of [[Lomé]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://africaexclusive.net/togo-eranove/|title=CENTRALE ELECTRIQUE DE KEKELI {{!}} Le Togo signe avec Eranove|date=2018-10-25|website=Africa Exclusive|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: Atinkou
texts.value: On September 5, 2016, the Eranove Group signed an agreement protocol with Côte d'Ivoire for the financing, design, construction, operation and maintenance of a thermal combined cycle power plant of 390 MW, followed by the signing of a concession agreement on 19 December 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/expertises/economiser-les-ressources/|title=Économiser les ressources|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.agenceecofin.com/production/2012-62810-letat-de-cote-divoire-et-le-groupe-eranove-signent-une-convention-de-concession-pour-une-centrale-electrique-de-390-mw|title=L'État de Côte d'Ivoire et le Groupe Eranove signent une convention de concession pour une centrale électrique de 390 MW|last=ERANOVE|website=Agence Ecofin|language=fr-fr|access-date=2019-01-07}}</ref> The Atinkou power plant will use natural gas as its main fuel and will be located on the edge of Abidjan.<ref name=":6" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.afrik21.africa/en/ivory-coast-eranove-wraps-up-financing-for-its-390-mw-power-plant-atinkou/|title = IVORY COAST: Eranove wraps up financing for its 390 MW power plant, Atinkou|date = 10 March 2020}}</ref>

texts.title: Orélo
texts.value: In October 2018, the signing of the concession agreement for the Orélo water treatment plant followed the agreement protocol signed in March 2017 by the Republic of Gabon, the FGIS and the Eranove Group.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/le-fonds-gabonais-dinvestissements-strategiques-fgis-et-le-groupe-eranove-signent-trois-contrats-avec-la-republique-gabonaise/|title=Le Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) et le Groupe Eranove signent trois contrats avec la République Gabonaise|date=2018-10-26|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> This contract deals with the financing, design, construction, operation and maintenance of a new clean drinking water production plant with a production capacity of 140,000 m3 per day, situated in the [[Estuaire Province]], more specifically in the district of Komo-Kango.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.hydroworld.com/articles/2018/11/gabon-to-develop-two-hydro-plants-water-production-unit.html|title=Gabon to develop two hydro plants, water production unit|website=www.hydroworld.com|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: Kenié Énergie Renouvelable
texts.value: Through its affiliate Kénié Énergie Renouvelable (Kénié Renewable Energy), the Eranove Group signed on June 18, 2015, with the government of the Republic of Mali a concession agreement with a duration of 30 years for the financing, design, construction and operation of the 42MW Kénié hydroelectric power plant, 35 km east of Bamako in Baguinéda on the [[Niger River]].<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.agenceecofin.com/hydroelectricite/1806-29910-eranove-s-engage-dans-l-energie-hydroelectrique-au-mali|title=Eranove s'engage dans l'énergie hydroélectrique au Mali|last=Ecofin|first=Agence|website=Agence Ecofin|language=fr-fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.waterpowermagazine.com/news/newseranove-to-develop-42mw-hydro-plant-in-mali-4606125|title=Eranove to develop 42MW hydro plant in Mali - International Water Power|website=www.waterpowermagazine.com|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: Asokh Energy
texts.value: On 21 October 2016, the Eranove Group and the Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) signed a concession contract with the Gabonese State for the design, financing, construction and operation of the Asokh Energy hydroelectric power plant (Ngoulmendjim site, 73 MW) on 26 October 2018.<ref name=":9">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/655132/economie/eau-et-electricite-eranove-obtient-des-marches-au-gabon-et-au-togo/|title=Eau et électricité : Eranove obtient des marchés au Gabon et au Togo|date=2018-10-29|website=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref> This hydroelectric power plant, located on the [[Komo River]], is going  to supply Libreville.<ref name=":10">{{Cite web|url=http://reussirbusiness.com/actualites/deficit-electricite-gabon-les-societes-asokh-energy-et-louetsi-hydro-comme-solution/|title=Déficit électricité Gabon : Les sociétés Asokh Energy et Louetsi Hydro comme solution|date=2018-05-15|website=La référence du Business au Sénégal|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: Louetsi Energy
texts.value: On 21 October 2016, the Eranove group and the Fonds Gabonais d'Investissements Stratégiques (FGIS) signed a concession contract with the Gabonese State for the design, financing, construction and operation of the Louetsi Hydro (15 MW) [[Hydroelectricity|hydroelectric power plant]] and on 26 October 2018, the contract for the sale of electricity.<ref name=":9" /> This run-of-river hydroelectric power plant, located 450 km from the capital on the [[Louetsié River|Louetsi River]], on the Dibwangui site, is dedicated to supplying the southwestern part of the country.<ref name=":10" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/afrique/louetsi-energy/|title=Louetsi Energy|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2019-01-07}}</ref>

texts.title: Cavally
texts.value: In 2014 the Eranove Group signed an agreement protocol related to hydroelectric planning for the [[Cavalla River|Cavally River]]. This protocol commits Eranove to the design, financing, construction and operation of hydroelectric facilities on the Cavally River, within the framework of a BOO (Build-Own-Operate) contract.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eranove.com/afrique/|title=Afrique|website=Eranove|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>

texts.title: Sahofika
texts.value: A consortium made up of the Eranove, Eiffage and Themis Groups on December 2, 2016, signed a project agreement with the Republic of Madagascar for the construction and operation of a 200 MW capacity hydroelectric power plant.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lexpressmada.com/06/07/2018/energie-la-future-centrale-de-sahofika-sort-de-leau/|title=Energie - La future centrale de Sahofika sort de l'eau • L'Express de Madagascar|last=Rakotobe|first=Harilalaina|date=2018-07-06|website=L'Express de Madagascar|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref><ref name=":5" />

texts.title: RSE
texts.value: Through its subsidiaries, the group is committed to all the facets of ISO 26 000 CSR and to ISO 9001 quality, OHSAS 18001 safety and ISO 1400160 environmental certification.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fr.africanews.com/2018/10/23/la-republique-togolaise-et-le-groupe-eranove-signent-une-convention-de-concession-pour-une-centrale-electrique-de-65mw/|title=La République Togolaise et le Groupe Eranove signent une convention de concession pour une centrale électrique de 65MW|last=AfricaNews|date=2018-10-23|website=Africanews|language=fr|access-date=2018-12-19}}</ref>
